extendedIngredients.name: chocolate shavings
extendedIngredients.originalString: berries and chocolate shavings for garnish

recipes.title: Chocolate Creme Brûlée // Arvo Watch Giveaway

winePairing.pairingText: Southern works really well with Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. You could try Poet's Leap Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Poet's Leap Riesling
productMatches.description: Key lime and fresh citrus peel aromas give way to vivid layers of white peach and stone fruit flavors accented by a pleasant touch of minerality. Delicious natural acidity and a hint of residual sugar provide a balanced, vibrant mouth-feel and lengthy finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.In a large sauce pan heat sugar, chocolate, and cocoa powder and bring to just a boil.  Stir continuously so that chocolate incorporates into the cream.Remove from heat and let cook.Mean while in a stand mixer, using the whist attachment whisk eggs and sugar until they are pale yellow.with the whisk still moving slowly add the chocolate cream mixture.  If you add it too fast it will cook the eggs, so add about 1/4 cup at a time whisking in-between each addition.Once incorporated divide between ramekins, so half pint mason jars.  Place in a baking dish and fill the dish with hot water until the water reaches half way up the sides of the jars.Bake for 40-45 minutes.Remove from oven and let cook for 1 hour.Transfer to the fridge and chill for 2 hours.Sprinkle sugar on the top of each and caramelize the sugar one of two ways.  The first is to use a kitchen torch and in a circular motion melt sugar until it is golden brown.  Let cool for 5 minutes.  The second is to use your oven broiler.  Broil on high for 8-10 minutes until sugar bubbles.  Let cool for 15 minutes.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.In a large sauce pan heat sugar, chocolate, and cocoa powder and bring to just a boil.  Stir continuously so that chocolate incorporates into the cream.

Remove from heat and let cook.Mean while in a stand mixer, using the whist attachment whisk eggs and sugar until they are pale yellow.with the whisk still moving slowly add the chocolate cream mixture.  If you add it too fast it will cook the eggs, so add about 1/4 cup at a time whisking in-between each addition.Once incorporated divide between ramekins, so half pint mason jars.
Place in a baking dish and fill the dish with hot water until the water reaches half way up the sides of the jars.
Remove from oven and let cook for 1 hour.

Transfer to the fridge and chill for 2 hours.Sprinkle sugar on the top of each and caramelize the sugar one of two ways.  The first is to use a kitchen torch and in a circular motion melt sugar until it is golden brown.
Let cool for 5 minutes.  The second is to use your oven broiler.  Broil on high for 8-10 minutes until sugar bubbles.
